newsitem.title: UK: LME copper inches up in late trade, support holds.
newsitem.headline: LME copper inches up in late trade, support holds.

text.p: LME copper nudged slightly higher in late inter-office trading on Tuesday after having remained well defended on dips below $2,120 per tonne throughout the day.
Prices edged up to be indicated at $2,137/40 by 1900 GMT, compared with an afternoon kerb close of $2,136 a tonne, up $3 from Monday's kerb.
Conditions throughout the complex were fairly low-key and traders said that the red metal looked to be favouring a range-trading pattern.

Traders said while next week's "third Wednesday" hurdle remained to be overcome, there was less concern over the December date now -- compared with two weeks ago -- as many positions had been squared off.
The other metals were little changed in late activity.
